CatDescriptText: Miss Sarah Thomas, secretary, Beltzhoover and Mr. Joseph Breier, photographic equipment salesman, Mt. Oliver, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 14, 1962, pg. 17 with question: "Do you think it is ethical or right for a doctor to go on 'strike' as a protest?"  Ms. Thomas' answer reads: "A doctor should have more of an interest in humanity than just public recognition or money.  It's a part of his professional duty."  Mr. Brier's answer reads: "No.  My reason?  My eight children.  Suppose my doctor went out on strike and one of my kids became ill.  If I could find a doctor, he would be a stranger who wouldn't be familiar with their case histories.  You have to have confidence in the sort of man who gives you medical attention."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Sarah Thomas wearing eyeglasses and light colored short sleeve dress, standing next to truck; Portrait of Joseph Breier wearing eyeglasses and short sleeve button down collared shirt, standing next to truck
